author: Staff Reporter
text:
The Labour Department has asked organisations to deposit the wages of workers in their bank accounts to ensure they receive their minimum wages.

A release from the Labour Inspector said that as per the Minimum Wages Act, hotels, tobacco manufacturers and shops should deposit the wages of their workers in the bank accounts. The organisations should ensure that the wages were deposited on time, the release added. The release said that many workers were from North India and their wages and other financial benefits should only be deposited in their bank accounts. Hence, all workers should submit details of their bank accounts to their organisations.

The release said that all organisations should follow the procedure without fail.
title: Organisations asked to deposit wages in workers’ bank accounts
